result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Lasha Beard in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Christopher Lasha Beard.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lasha Beard in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Christopher Lasha Beard.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. State requests an adjournment of the jury trial. Defense objects. Court grants request and sets matter for a final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lasha Beard in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final Pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. State placed final offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. State withdrew their offer to the defendant. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 9/6/22, in Br 29.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Christopher Lasha Beard in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lasha Beard in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Dorian Moore - MPD Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with QH and RMB.

Defendant Christopher Lasha Beard in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@2:00pm
